feed.subtitle: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step

entry.title: Step by step resetting Bluetooth on Mac OS
entry.content:
Latest Mac OS High Sierra version 10.13.6.

  • Open Terminal and login as user “root”:
  • Reset the Bluetooth Module wiht Option + Shift + click on bluetooth icon in taskbar. Click on Debug -> Reset the Bluetooth Module
  • Reset PRAM / NVRAM: Shut down; power on, immediately press Command + Option + P + R until it resets itself a couple times. Official guide https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT204063
  • Reset SMC: Shut down; hold down Shift + Control + Option while holding the power button for 10 seconds. Official guide https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201295
entry.summary:
Latest Mac OS High Sierra version 10.13.6.

  • Open Terminal and login as user “root”:

entry.title: Making VSCode like IntelliJ after line commented the cursor automatically moved to next line
entry.content:
Want to make VSCode key bindings as closed as IntelliJ key bindings like.

Firstly, install VSCode extension macros.

Open Code -> Preferences -> Settings. Add following configuration into User Settings.

Open Code -> Preferences -> Keyboard Shortcuts. Add following configuration into keybindings.json file.

That’s newly added Toggle Line Comment looks like after the change:
entry.summary:

Firstly, install VSCode extension macros

entry.title: Setup and run DEVHINTS.IO cheatsheets on localhost
entry.content:
This is a static website based on Jekyll framework https://jekyllrb.com/. Need install Jekyll and .

Login as user “root” due to write permission required into /Library/Ruby/Gems directory. Install bundler and Jekyll at first:

Then install all this application dependent libraries:

Start up Jekyll website on localhost, with user “terrence” this time:

Go to URL: http://127.0.0.1:4000 start searching and using cheatsheets in localhost environment:

To generate static web content ONLY:

Then can upload published website content from ../terrencemiao.github.io/cheatsheets directory to https://terrencemiao.github.io.
entry.summary: This is a static website based on Jekyll framework https://jekyllrb.com/

entry.title: The Evolution of Mobile Phones
entry.content:
Bigger and bigger screen, fewer and fewer buttons, more and more entertaining, less and less thinking.

屏幕越来越大，按键越来越少。
娱乐越来越多，思考越来越少。
entry.summary:
Bigger and bigger screen, fewer and fewer buttons, more and more entertaining, less and less thinking.

屏幕越来越大，按键越来越少。
娱乐越来越多，思考

entry.title: 心流 / 心流れ / Flow
entry.content:
A feeling of complete absorption when you’re engaged in something you love to do without being disrupted by anxiety or boredom.

References

  • Flow (psychology), https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flow_(psychology)
entry.summary: A feeling of complete absorption when you’re engaged in something you love to do without being disrupted by anxiety or boredom.

entry.title: The longest official place name in Australia
entry.content: Mamungkukumpurangkuntjunya Hill, is a hill in South Australia. The name means “where the devil urinates” in the regional Pitjantjatjara language. The name is the longest official place name in Australia. The hill is located approximately 108.8 km west north-west of Marla.
entry.summary: Mamungkukumpurangkuntjunya Hill, is a hill in South Australia. The name means “where the devil urinates” in the regional

entry.title: House Prices Down Under
entry.content:
A look at historical house prices in Sydney and Melbourne from 1880 to 2010.

Melbourne Median vs Average Wage 1965 - 2010.

It must be remembered that house prices are determined by the demand and supply of credit, not the demand for and supply of housing.

房价不与国民收入，社会福利放在一起进行讨论，无异于光天化日里耍流氓。
entry.summary: A look at historical house prices in Sydney and Melbourne from 1880 to 2010.

entry.title: RESTful calls to create Index and Mappings in ElasticSearch
entry.content:
There is a simple way, using RESTful client to create Index and Mappings in ElasticSearch, for example, with ElasticSearch Head plugin.

Create Index in ElasticSearch with Settings JSON file. URL: http://localhost:9200/orders/, Method: PUT

Create Mappings in ElasticSearch with Mappings JSON file. URL: http://localhost:9200/orders/_mapping/order, Method: PUT

To add a new fields to ElasticSearch, while dynamic mapping is off:

Run with additional fields JSON file, with URL: http://localhost:9200/orders/_mapping/order, Method: PUT

An ElasticSearch query example, with URL: http://localhost:9200/orders/_search, Method: POST

An example query with date/time type in a range:
entry.summary: There is a simple way, using RESTful client to create Index and Mappings in ElasticSearch, for example, with ElasticSearch Head plugin.

entry.title: AWS access key id and secret access key
entry.content:
There are some secret of AWS credentials, i.e., its Access Key ID and Secret Access Key, which let you connect AWS services withouth authentication.

In a quintessential project environment, you have dev, test, prod environment setup in AWS. Your local AWS_PROFILE is something like this so you can switch to different targeting end services while run your application on localhost:

When test Jest client in Test environment, a AWS ElasticSearch client library, error thrown:

It turns out that WRONG Dev AWS_PROFILE applied in Test environment.

Replacing “aws_access_key_id” and “aws_secret_access_key” from the default profile with “aws_access_key_id” and “aws_secret_access_key” from test profile:

Rerun the test and in log:
entry.summary: There are some secret of AWS credentials, i.e., its Access Key ID and Secret Access Key, which let you connect AWS services withouth auth

entry.title: AWS ElasticSearch and Kibana proxy setup
entry.content:
There are several ways to access Amazon AWS ElasticSearch and Kibana services, which are HTTP based, without inject into HTTP request headers with authentication key …

AWS ES Proxy

Install a proxy application - AWS ES/Kibana Proxy. Download it from https://www.npmjs.com/package/aws-es-kibana and install:

Run AWS ES/Kibana Proxy then connect to ElasticSearch and Kibana services on AWS:

With Fish Shell:

SSH Tunnel

Set up SSH Tunnel for AWS ElasticSearch https://search-paradise-esv5-test-01-esd-blah23dlaoed81nz890adle4.ap-southeast-2.es.amazonaws.com from 443 port to localhost 9200:

Then access AWS ElasticSearch at: https://localhost:9200, AWS Kibana at: https://localhost:9200/_plugin/kibana

ElasticSearch Head

With plugin ElasticSearch Head, to query ElasticSearch, using URL and index “orders-search-box” e.g. https://localhost:9200/orders-search-test/, and context path “_search”
entry.summary: There are several ways to access Amazon AWS ElasticSearch and Kibana services, which are HTTP based, without inject into HTTP request hea
